authors.name: Ebsy Jaimon

authors.name: Suzanne R Pfeffer
authors.affiliation: Stanford University School of Medicine and Aligning Science Across Parkinson's

description: {"blocks":[{"key":"9re57","text":"Here we present a CellProfiler (1) software pipeline to quantify the localization of PPM1H on mitochondria.  In this work, we have fragmented the mitochondria by hypotonic swelling to facilitate localization and highlight membrane contacts (2); PPM1H-mApple labeled pixels that coincide with GFP-Mito labeled pixels are scored. Wild-type MEFs expressing PPM1H-mApple and GFP-Mito are treated with oligomycin/antimycin (4 hours) and then incubated for 2 minutes in a hypotonic medium.  Images of live cells are acquired using a spinning disk confocal microscope. The multi-channel Z-stack images are maximum intensity projected and used for CellProfiler analysis.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
materials_text: {"blocks":[{"key":"1th64","text":"1) .TIFF files from Spinning disk confocal microscope","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1lvbh","text":"2) FIJI/imageJ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3ougk","text":"3) CellProfiler software 4.04 or later*","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5tb20","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2cfmv","text":"*Stirling DR, Swain-Bowden MJ, Lucas AM, Carpenter AE, Cimini BA, Goodman A (2021). CellProfiler 4: improvements in speed, utility and usability. BMC Bioinformatics, 22 (1), 433. PMID: 34507520 PMCID: PMC8431850.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"cekuu","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"29gjd","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
protocol_references: {"blocks":[{"key":"2a631","text":"(1)  Stirling DR, Swain-Bowden MJ, Lucas AM, Carpenter AE, Cimini BA, Goodman A (2021). CellProfiler 4: improvements in speed, utility and usability. BMC Bioinformatics, 22 (1), 433. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"cei21","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5pfvu","text":"(2) King C, Sengupta P, Seo AY, Lippincott-Schwartz J. ER membranes exhibit phase behavior at sites of organelle contact. Proc Natl Acad Sci U S A. 2020 Mar 31;117(13):7225-7235. doi: 10.1073/pnas.1910854117. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

status.info: We use this protocol and it's working

steps.section: Batch process images and import files into CellProfiler
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"fi3eb","text":"Use the FIJI macro as described in dx.doi.org/10.17504/protocols.io.3byl4bpo8vo5/v1 to maximum intensity Z project the images. Open the folder with the images that need to be processed, choose the channel and the output folder, run code for maximum intensity Z projection, and save the files as .TIFF.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"UNDERLINE","offset":35,"length":48}],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":34,"length":49}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"283017C77B8011EFBBC20A58A9FEAC02","url":"https://dx.doi.org/10.17504/protocols.io.3byl4bpo8vo5/v1"}}}}

steps.section: Batch process images and import files into CellProfiler
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"14hc9","text":"Open CellProfiler software. Go to the Images module, drag and drop the maximum intensity projected .TIFF files as indicated. Select “no filtering” in the filter images option.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Batch process images and import files into CellProfiler
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"7453b","text":"Go to the Metadata module to extract information describing the images.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"6cas9","text":"Click on the “+” sign at the bottom left next to Adjust Modules. Under the module categories, click Advanced, and then choose Gaussian filter.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"2hbkr","text":"Check by selecting “Start Test Mode” and select the green triangle next to the IdentifyPrimaryObjects module each time a parameter is changed to find the best parameters for each image set. {"blocks":[{"key":"1qtpo","text":"Select objects to measure: Choose Maskedppm1h and PPM1Hobjects","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"73j5r","text":"Add ExportToSpreadsheet module from the + at the bottom to export the measurements into files that can be opened in Excel. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"f53nd","text":"Output file location: choose a folder where images will be saved","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"7ahp7","text":"Add image metadata columns to your object data file? Yes","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"cv4qv","text":"Add image file and folder names to your object data file? No","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"4g93r","text":"Click Press button to select measurements: Under “Maskedppm1h” choose Intensity -\u003e IntegratedIntensity -\u003e PPM1H -\u003emApple. Under “PPM1Hobjects” choose Intensity -\u003e IntegratedIntensity -\u003e PPM1H -\u003e mApple","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"1ik4a","text":"Calculate the per-image mean values for object measurements? No","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"d0dpn","text":"Calculate the per-image median values for object measurements? No","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"b7cni","text":"Calculate per-image standard deviation values for object measurements? No","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"absi5","text":"Use the object name for the file name? Yes","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"a7uin","text":"Combine these object measurements with those of the previous object? Yes ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"3msta","text":"Enter regular expression to extract from file name:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6rhs6","text":"“Regex” will be ^_(?P\u003cimage_number\u003e[0-9]{2}) for an example file name “Image_22_w1561      Confocal.TIF_max.tif”. This step helps to extract the image number (22) from the file name.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"i7qk","text":"In Regex, ^ indicates the beginning of the file name and (?P\u003cimage_number\u003e[0-9]{2}) tells the program to name the captured field “image_number” and recognize two digits that follow. Click the magnifying glass icon on the right to check the accuracy of regular expression.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

The pipeline will run and export the data to the folder previously specified. The output .csv file will have distinct columns indicating image number, intensity of PPM1H-mApple labeled pixels that coincide with GFP-Mito labeled pixels, and intensity of all PPM1H-mApple labeled pixels.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4fpus","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"a0jpa","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
